roleset.name: worry about, be emotionally involved with, cause anxiety about
roleset.note: CONCERN-V NOTES: Based on sentences in financial subcorpus. Comparison to worry. Member of VNcls amuse-31.1. (from concern.01-v)
CONCERN-N NOTES: Based on verb roleset concern.01, but lacks arg2 instrument argument of verb. Corresponds to VNcls amuse-31.1. (from concern.01-n)
CONCERNING-J NOTES: Based on Sharp and Temprel data. Comparison to concern-v. Concern.01-v is a member of VN class amuse-31.1. Framed by Katie. (from concerning.01-j)
CONCERNED-J NOTES: Based on Thyme and Sharp data. Comparison to concern.01. Concern.01 is a memebr of VN class amuse-31.1. Framed by Katie. (from concerned.01-j)

example.name: transitive
example.text: The company said it-1 was ``concerned *T*-1 about the announced intent to acquire control of the company'' by a Sugarman-led group.
example.arg: about the announced intent to acquire control of the company '' by a Sugarman-led group

example.name: unaccusative
example.text: ``We-1 weren't concerned *T*-1 until they became sell programs,'' says Mr. DaPuzzo, who now thinks it adds unnecessary volatility.

example.name: with REC
example.text: The ultimate goal of any investor is a profit motive, and regulators should not concern themselves with whether investors are sufficiently focused on the long term.
example.arg: with whether investors are sufficiently focused on the long term

example.name: sentential arg0
example.text: ``We-1 were concerned *T*-1 that they weren't going to generate enough cash for capital spending and also to pay down debt,'' says a big investor in high-yield debt.
example.arg: that they weren't going to generate enough cash for capital spending and also to pay down debt

example.name: justification for prepositional arg0s
example.text: John-1 was concerned *T*-1 by the bugs crawling on his picnic lunch, but that didn't stop him from eating it.
example.arg: by the bugs crawling on his picnic lunch

example.name: Quasi-idiomatic usage
example.text: As far as I-1 'm concerned *-1, if a guy wants to wear a skirt and have long hair, as long as it looks good, anything goes.

example.name: active, not reciprocal, all args
example.text: John concerned everybody with his appetite for stink bugs.
example.arg: with his appetite for stink bugs

example.name: Both args, "over" phrase
example.text: Farmers voice their concern over impact of climate change.

example.name: Arg 1 only
example.text: The kinds and content of professional- development opportunities can be informed by ongoing monitoring of the concerns of teachers.

example.name: Both args, "about" phrase
example.text: The United Nations High Commissioner for Human Rights, Sergio Vieira de Mello, has raised his concerns about the treatment of detainees.

example.name: NOT EVENTIVE! Tag .YY!
example.text: Water is resource of the commonweal and ought never to be allowed to become captured by any private concern .

example.name: arg0
example.text: Mr. Newsome's history is concerning.

example.name: Arg 0 is often after the rel
example.text: She was concerned that we might recommend this therapy.
example.arg: that we might recommend this therapy.

roleset.name: deal with, have to do with, involved, pertained to
roleset.note: CONCERN-V NOTES: Member of VNcls relate-86.2-1. (from concern.02-v)
CONCERNED-J NOTES: Added by Julia based on BOLT-1, concern-v.02. Corresponds to VNcls relate-86.2-1. (from concerned.02-j)

roles.note: Do not tag Prepositional usages--where verb is the head of a PP (and there's no actual preposition in sight)! These are .ER cases. (from concern.02-v)

example.name: transitive
example.text: The company also said it continues to explore all options concerning the possible sale of National Aluminum's 54.5% stake in an aluminum smelter in Hawesville, Ky.
example.arg: the possible sale of National Aluminum's 54.5% stake in an aluminum smelter in Hawesville, Ky

example.name: arg1
example.text: And as far as an Islamic revolution is concerned i would say that it depends on how organized religious or clerical organizations are in a country and how politicized they are .

example.name: both args
example.text: However, since critical logic is concerned in part with necessary reasoning, it is dependent upon the character of mathematics (CP 4.240).

example.name: concerned in
example.text: Indeed, the whole Trinity is concerned in every work of God

roleset.name: indicating a particular condition or outcome.
roleset.note: CONCERNING-J NOTES: Based on Sharp and Temprel data. Comparison to concern-v. Concern.01-v is a member of VN class amuse-31.1. Framed by Katie. (from concerning.02-j)

example.name: all args
example.text: Some symptoms to me are concerning for gasteric outlet obstruction.

example.name: args 0, 2
example.text: CT - scan of his abdomen and pelvis was notable for [a mass on his left kidney-1] that [T-1]was concerning for renal cell carcinoma.

example.name: args 0, 2
example.text: This is concerning for a malignancy although we do not have pathologic evidence.
example.arg: although we do not have pathologic evidence
